pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the Fastdoc multi-variant chatbot system, explaining that it's an experimental/educational repository showcasing different LangGraph patterns and Streamlit frontend implementations

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Explain how to set up the environment, install dependencies, and run a basic chatbot variant

pages.title: Core Architecture
pages.purpose: Document the fundamental architectural patterns shared across all implementations: Streamlit frontends, LangGraph backends, and SQLite persistence

pages.title: Frontend Architecture Patterns
pages.purpose: Explain the common Streamlit frontend patterns: session state management, thread handling, message history, and streaming responses

pages.title: Backend Architecture Patterns
pages.purpose: Document the LangGraph StateGraph pattern, chat_node implementation, tool_node integration, and checkpointing mechanisms used across backends

pages.title: State Management Model
pages.purpose: Explain the dual-state architecture: ephemeral UI state in st.session_state versus persistent conversational state in SQLite checkpoints

pages.title: Message Flow and Lifecycle
pages.purpose: Trace the complete lifecycle of a message from user input through LangGraph processing, tool invocation (if applicable), and response streaming

pages.title: Standard Implementation Variants
pages.purpose: Document the core chatbot variants that demonstrate fundamental features: database integration, tool support, and threading

pages.title: Database-Integrated Chatbot
pages.purpose: Detailed documentation of the database-integrated variant (importance 5.80): thread management, conversation loading, and SqliteSaver checkpointing

pages.title: Tool-Enabled Chatbot
pages.purpose: Document the tool-enabled variant (importance 4.00): tool invocation workflow, status indicators, and the ai_only_stream pattern

pages.title: Threading-Enabled Frontend
pages.purpose: Explain the threading frontend variant (importance 3.65): concurrent message handling and its integration with the tool backend

pages.title: Basic and Streaming Variants
pages.purpose: Document the simpler implementations: basic chatbot with InMemorySaver and streaming-only frontend for comparison with database variants

pages.title: Advanced Features
pages.purpose: Cover sophisticated features that extend the base chatbot: RAG document retrieval, MCP protocol integration, and the tool ecosystem

pages.title: RAG System with PDF Ingestion
pages.purpose: Detailed documentation of the RAG system (importance 3.50): PDF upload and processing, FAISS vector stores, thread-specific retrieval, and the rag_tool implementation

pages.title: MCP Protocol Integration
pages.purpose: Document the MCP integration (importance 3.50): MultiServerMCPClient architecture, stdio and HTTP transports, dynamic tool discovery from arith and expense servers

pages.title: Tool Ecosystem
pages.purpose: Comprehensive documentation of all available tools: DuckDuckGo search, calculator, stock prices, rag_tool, and MCP-sourced tools

pages.title: Infrastructure and Dependencies
pages.purpose: Document the underlying infrastructure: SQLite persistence layer and the complete technology stack

pages.title: SQLite Persistence Layer
pages.purpose: Deep dive into SQLite WAL mode: checkpoints table schema, writes table structure, thread management, and the role of .db-shm and .db-wal files

pages.title: Technology Stack and Dependencies
pages.purpose: Document the complete dependency tree: LangChain/LangGraph, Streamlit, OpenAI integration, data processing libraries, and development tools
